      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195686#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I've got a fix ready. The problem is that we're displaying a secondary modal dialog (SPC) on top of a modal dialog (Payment Handler), and the way this was originally implemented is that the secondary dialog uses the browser's dialog host[1]. So this UAF works by pulling the SPC/payment handler tab out to a new browser window, while the PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate still holds a pointer to the old browser's dialog host.<span class="line"><!---->I've got a fix ready. The problem is that we're displaying a secondary modal dialog (SPC) on top of a modal dialog (Payment Handler), and the way this was originally implemented is that the secondary dialog uses the browser's dialog host[1]. So this UAF works by pulling the SPC/payment handler tab out to a new browser window, while the PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate still holds a pointer to the old browser's dialog host.<!----></span><br><br>Ideally we just shouldn't use the browser's dialog host (this doesn't fix the weirdness where the SPC dialog is stuck to the old browser window when the tab is detached), but the web contents' dialog host doesn't allow stacking the SPC dialog on top of the Payment Handler dialog. So I'll land+merge the simpler fix to ensure PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate returns the current browser dialog host, and take a follow-up task to improve this edge case.<span class="line"><!---->Ideally we just shouldn't use the browser's dialog host (this doesn't fix the weirdness where the SPC dialog is stuck to the old browser window when the tab is detached), but the web contents' dialog host doesn't allow stacking the SPC dialog on top of the Payment Handler dialog. So I'll land+merge the simpler fix to ensure PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate returns the current browser dialog host, and take a follow-up task to improve this edge case.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

f1<span class="line"><!---->  Stack left redzone:      f1<!----></span><br>  Stack mid redzone:       f2<span class="line"><!---->  Stack mid redzone:       f2<!----></span><br>  Stack right redzone:     f3<span class="line"><!---->  Stack right redzone:     f3<!----></span><br>  Stack after return:      f5<span class="line"><!---->  Stack after return:      f5<!----></span><br>  Stack use after scope:   f8<span class="line"><!---->  Stack use after scope:   f8<!----></span><br>  Global redzone:          f9<span class="line"><!---->  Global redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>  Shadow gap:              cc<span class="line"><!---->  Shadow gap:              cc<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. I'm having trouble reproducing this as-is. I'm fairly certain you missed a step to install the "credential enrollment payment handler", based on your test page, but even doing that doesn't reliably reproduce the crash.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I'm having trouble reproducing this as-is. I'm fairly certain you missed a step to install the "credential enrollment payment handler", based on your test page, but even doing that doesn't reliably reproduce the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Can you make a self-contained PoC for this problem? Because there seem to be a lot of remote resources involved in this crash, and I suspect some of them are interfering with reliable reproduction.<span class="line"><!---->Can you make a self-contained PoC for this problem? Because there seem to be a lot of remote resources involved in this crash, and I suspect some of them are interfering with reliable reproduction.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 16<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195686#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      nburris@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/362216878" title="nburris@chromium.org"><!---->nburris@chromium.org<!----></a>
      nburris@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->nburris@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195686#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195686#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I've got a fix ready. The problem is that we're displaying a secondary modal dialog (SPC) on top of a modal dialog (Payment Handler), and the way this was originally implemented is that the secondary dialog uses the browser's dialog host[1]. So this UAF works by pulling the SPC/payment handler tab out to a new browser window, while the PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate still holds a pointer to the old browser's dialog host.<span class="line"><!---->I've got a fix ready. The problem is that we're displaying a secondary modal dialog (SPC) on top of a modal dialog (Payment Handler), and the way this was originally implemented is that the secondary dialog uses the browser's dialog host[1]. So this UAF works by pulling the SPC/payment handler tab out to a new browser window, while the PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate still holds a pointer to the old browser's dialog host.<!----></span><br><br>Ideally we just shouldn't use the browser's dialog host (this doesn't fix the weirdness where the SPC dialog is stuck to the old browser window when the tab is detached), but the web contents' dialog host doesn't allow stacking the SPC dialog on top of the Payment Handler dialog. So I'll land+merge the simpler fix to ensure PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate returns the current browser dialog host, and take a follow-up task to improve this edge case.<span class="line"><!---->Ideally we just shouldn't use the browser's dialog host (this doesn't fix the weirdness where the SPC dialog is stuck to the old browser window when the tab is detached), but the web contents' dialog host doesn't allow stacking the SPC dialog on top of the Payment Handler dialog. So I'll land+merge the simpler fix to ensure PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate returns the current browser dialog host, and take a follow-up task to improve this edge case.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        by

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Apr 15, 2021, 10:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195686#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Apr 15, 2021, 10:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/0681f72f48cfd31fb6e6599cc87ca20a517484e1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/0681f72f48cfd31fb6e6599cc87ca20a517484e1"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/0681f72f48cfd31fb6e6599cc87ca20a517484e1<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>0681f72f48cfd31fb6e6599cc87ca20a517484e1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/0681f72f48cfd31fb6e6599cc87ca20a517484e1"><!---->0681f72f48cfd31fb6e6599cc87ca20a517484e1<!----></a><br>Author: Nick Burris <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Nick Burris &lt;<!----></span>nburris@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/nburris@chromium.org"><!---->nburris@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Apr 15 14:31:20 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Apr 15 14:31:20 2021<!----></span><br><br>Make PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate return the active host<span class="line"><!---->Make PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate return the active host<!----></span><br><br>The PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate provides the browser's<span class="line"><!---->The PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate provides the browser's<!----></span><br>dialog host for showing additional modal dialogs such as Secure Payment<span class="line"><!---->dialog host for showing additional modal dialogs such as Secure Payment<!----></span><br>Confirmation.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>

        Thanks for the report. I'm having trouble reproducing this as-is. I'm fairly certain you missed a step to install the "credential enrollment payment handler", based on your test page, but even doing that doesn't reliably reproduce the crash.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I'm having trouble reproducing this as-is. I'm fairly certain you missed a step to install the "credential enrollment payment handler", based on your test page, but even doing that doesn't reliably reproduce the crash.<!----></span><br><br>Can you make a self-contained PoC for this problem? Because there seem to be a lot of remote resources involved in this crash, and I suspect some of them are interfering with reliable reproduction.<span class="line"><!---->Can you make a self-contained PoC for this problem? Because there seem to be a lot of remote resources involved in this crash, and I suspect some of them are interfering with reliable reproduction.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report! Can repro. The root issue, as shown in the video in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! Can repro. The root issue, as shown in the video in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a>, is that the dialog is attached to the wrong webcontents when the new window is split. This is only an issue when SPC is invoked from the modal window web contents. Still investigating the fix. This issue is only in M91 as the feature was completely disabled prior.<span class="line"><!---->, is that the dialog is attached to the wrong webcontents when the new window is split. This is only an issue when SPC is invoked from the modal window web contents. Still investigating the fix. This issue is only in M91 as the feature was completely disabled prior.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 16<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195686#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>

      nburris@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->nburris@chromium.org<!----></span>

    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195686#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195686#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 13, 2021, 8:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I've got a fix ready. The problem is that we're displaying a secondary modal dialog (SPC) on top of a modal dialog (Payment Handler), and the way this was originally implemented is that the secondary dialog uses the browser's dialog host[1]. So this UAF works by pulling the SPC/payment handler tab out to a new browser window, while the PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate still holds a pointer to the old browser's dialog host.<span class="line"><!---->I've got a fix ready. The problem is that we're displaying a secondary modal dialog (SPC) on top of a modal dialog (Payment Handler), and the way this was originally implemented is that the secondary dialog uses the browser's dialog host[1]. So this UAF works by pulling the SPC/payment handler tab out to a new browser window, while the PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate still holds a pointer to the old browser's dialog host.<!----></span><br><br>Ideally we just shouldn't use the browser's dialog host (this doesn't fix the weirdness where the SPC dialog is stuck to the old browser window when the tab is detached), but the web contents' dialog host doesn't allow stacking the SPC dialog on top of the Payment Handler dialog. So I'll land+merge the simpler fix to ensure PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate returns the current browser dialog host, and take a follow-up task to improve this edge case.<span class="line"><!---->Ideally we just shouldn't use the browser's dialog host (this doesn't fix the weirdness where the SPC dialog is stuck to the old browser window when the tab is detached), but the web contents' dialog host doesn't allow stacking the SPC dialog on top of the Payment Handler dialog. So I'll land+merge the simpler fix to ensure PaymentHandlerModalDialogManagerDelegate returns the current browser dialog host, and take a follow-up task to improve this edge case.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.cc;l=213-216;drc=57544c227ec492b8574ec8163def47ff57d36511<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

This patch ensures the current browser's dialog host is<span class="line"><!---->Confirmation.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

        </div>
        
      <br>
      
    
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>
    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>


        
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
